alert.note: Alert for Powder River (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 25 at 11:32AM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: .Powder River County officials report ice jams along the Powder River. One is about 7 miles south of Broadus and is causing water to back up and flood nearby locations. Another is just northeast of Broadus causing minor flooding in the Broadus vicinity. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by ice jamming continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Montana, including the following county, Powder River. * WHEN...Until 600 PM MDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of areas along and near the Powder River as water backs up behind ice jams. Depending on ice behavior, any release of an ice jam could also result in sudden rises of water downstream, leading to a rapid flooding situation. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1128 AM MDT, Powder River County officials report flooding continues in the warned area. - People downstream from the warned area along the Powder River in northeast Powder River County should also remain alert and be prepared for ice jamming and possible flooding. Occasional light snow is expected over the impacted area this weekend. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... The Broadus vicinity, and areas up to 10 miles south of Broadus along the Powder River. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Stay away or be swept away. River banks can become unstable and unsafe. Move livestock and farm equipment to safe locations.
